Key: Maria, let's go on a date.

...Yes. Does this mean you will fulfill your
promise?

Y-Yeah... I guess that's how things are
ending up. So, sure?
It was worth it for you to owe me one.
What are you talking about...?
It is a secret.

Maria, I notice you've been smiling more
often.
Is it strange for me to express emotions?

Now, that's not true. In fact, I think smiling
suits you well, Maria.
I-Is that so...? How embarrassing.

It's nothing to be embarrassed about.
Now then. Is there somewhere you'd like
to go?
Somewhere I'd like to go...?

Yeah. Actually, even though it's a date, I can't
think of any place you'd want to go. Do you have
any suggestions, Maria?

I would enjoy taking my time to walk around
the city. Is that an adequate request?
Is that all you want?
Yes. That is fine.

Then, for now, why don't we take a walk around
the shopping district?

So you want to take a walk around the city,
huh? Well, this part's kind of nice, but it's
not exactly the real thing, is it?

Not exactly. However I haven't seen it for
myself, so the feeling is new.

Really? But don't you know everything about
this world?

I know its informational make-up, but seeing
it for myself is a new experience.
Is that so? I don't get the difference.

Yes. The buildings are larger up close, and
the streets are livelier.

(As Maria spoke, she turned and looked
above us. It seemed like she was enjoying
herself. I've never seen Maria act this way.)

I'm sure it's hard to keep track of each and
every person who lives in this city, so for me,
it looks more deserted than usual.
Your world must be so lively, Shido.
Yeah, it is. There are many, many more people.
I see... I hope to witness it first-hand.
That'd be―
Oh. It's you, Nii-sama.
Whoaaa. Mana?!
The hell are you doin' in a place like this?
Just taking a walk. Haha... Hahaha.

(We're walking along the shopping district,
so the amount of familiar faces makes sense.
Why didn't I realize it sooner...?)
So, who the hell is the girl next to you?
Is she your new, freakin' girlfriend?

No no no. Maria's not my girlfriend!
We're just walking around because she
asked to.
Hrm...

I see. So that's what it is. Jeez, you go through
girls quick, Nii-sama, that's why I'm so freakin'
worried.
You don't have to worry about that!
...Shido, let us go.
Huh? Hey, Maria... Wait up!
Sorry Mana, I'll see you later!
Ah, Nii-sama...?!

(I spun around and chased after Maria, who
left in the middle of the conversation.)

(Her quick steps are a completely different
gait than how it was when she was enjoying
herself earlier. Maria's ignoring me now.)
Hey, Maria. Wait up.

(As I call to her to stop, she sulked, slowly
turning to face me.)
Shido. Am I merely an acquaintance?

Well, that's what we are to each other,
right?

Shido, you invited me on a date. Even then,
am I a mere acquaintance to you?

R-Right. Um. We're pretty close acquaintances,
I guess.

That will do for the time being. However, right
now, we are on a date. Younger sister or not, I
cannot approve you being approached by women.

Yeah, but she initiated the conversation, so it
couldn't be helped, right?
...Even so.
S-Sorry...

You need to understand women better,
Shido.
Yeah, I get that a lot...
*sigh*...
(Hmm. What do I do...?)
Apologize.
Make an excuse.

Maria, I'm sorry! I'll definitely be more careful
next time!

(I put my hands together, as if in prayer,
and lowered my head.)
You must, all right?
Yeah, please forgive me. I mean it!

There is no point in repeating myself,
so I will forgive you. However, in return...
In return?
Please teach me... much, much more, Shido.
R-Right...

You don't really seem like the jealous type,
Maria.

It is not jealousy. I was merely pointing out
your insincerity, Shido.

Either way, I only chatted with Mana for
a bit. Please cheer up.
I cannot. If you really insist, then...
If I insist?
Please teach me... much, much more, Shido.
I-I understand. I'll do my best.
(All right. Looks like Maria's feeling better.)
Now, let us continue our date.
Yes, let's.

(After our conversation, we continued our
stroll.)
Shido.
What's wrong?

(Something piqued Maria's interest, and
she called out my name suddenly.)
Those are our classmates.
Th-That's...?

(What Maria had been pointing at was the
trio of Ai, Mai, and Mii.)

If they see us walking together... We'll be in
a lot of trouble.

They will most certainly spread false rumors
about you.

Most likely. Sorry, but we should probably
get out of sight.

I understand. Then, I will leave this area
first.
No, you don't have to go that far.
It is much better this way. Is that okay?
All right, then. Sorry...
No, it is fine. For now, Shido. Good-bye.

(For now, if I'm alone, then running into them
shouldn't be an issue. I'm worried about Maria,
but I'll just grab ingredients and head home.)
